data.title: David Cameron Says UK Voters Haven’t Written Off Conservatives Yet
data.meta_description: Foreign Secretary David Cameron said UK voters had not yet decided to abandon Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives, despite the party trailing Labour by about 20 percentage points in opinion polls ahead of a general election expected in the second half of 2024.
data.text:
UK says Tehran could face more sanctions over Houthi rebels

Foreign Secretary David Cameron speaks to Bloomberg in Davos

Foreign Secretary David Cameron said UK voters had not yet decided to abandon Prime Minister Rishi Sunak ’s Conservatives, despite the party trailing Labour by about 20 percentage points in opinion polls ahead of a general election expected in the second half of 2024.

Cameron, who served as Britain’s prime minister from 2010 to 2016 and was brought back into the cabinet by Sunak in November, likened the governing party’s current position with that in the lead-up to the 2015 general election.
